author: Doug Cameron
title: United Trims Some of Its Capacity Growth Plans for This Year
text:
United Continental Holdings Inc. said it is cutting back on some extra flying this year after rattling airline investors in January with plans for additional capacity that raised fears of an industry fare war.
The nationâ€™s No. 3 airline by traffic on Tuesday revised its planned capacity increase for the year to a range of 4.5% to 5.5%. In January, it had said it would expand capacity by 4% to 6% in each of the next three years. United also boosted its full-year profit guidance after reporting consensus-beating quarterly profits.
